Package chess

Class ChessModel

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
chess.ChessModel
public class ChessModel extends Observable
This model method is to basically implement the board 8 by 8, and move the pieces in the board.
Author:
Colin Johnson, Megan Herzog

    • ChessModel

      public ChessModel()
      ChessModel no args constructor Creates an internal board of pieces in a 2D array. Empty spaces are null

    • makeMove

      public boolean makeMove​(int xFrom, int yFrom, int xTo, int yTo)
      makeMove makes a move for a given piece to another space, and notifies observers if a move is valid
      Parameters:
      xFrom - piece moving xCord
      yFrom - piece moving yCord
      xTo - position moving to xCord
      yTo - position moving to yCord
      Returns:
      boolean true if the move is successful, false otehrwise

    • makeMoveSub

      public boolean makeMoveSub​(int xFrom, int yFrom, int xTo, int yTo)
      makeMoveSub makes a move for a given piece to another space on the board
      Parameters:
      xFrom - piece moving xCord
      yFrom - piece moving yCord
      xTo - position moving to xCord
      yTo - position moving to yCord
      Returns:
      boolean true if the move is successful, false otehrwise

    • check

      public boolean check​(int player)
      check checks whether the King of a given side is in check
      Parameters:
      player - int which side is checked
      Returns:
      boolean true if King is in check, false otherwise

    • checkMate

      public boolean checkMate​(int player)
      checkMate checks whether the King in check has any moves or any protection moves
      Parameters:
      player - int which side is checked
      Returns:
      boolean true if King is in check mate, false otherwise

    • isGameOver

      public int isGameOver()
      isGameOver
      Parameters:
      player - int which side is checked
      Returns:
      int, 0 if no winner yet, 1 if white wins, 2 if black wins

      printing the state of the board setup.
